articles.title: Toddlers Who Eat Fish Have Lower Developmental Delay Risks - Neuroscience News
articles.description: This study offers new insights into dietary impacts on early childhood development and the importance of microbial diversity in nutrient utilization.
articles.content:
Summary: Introducing fish to toddlers’ diets could reduce their risk of neurodevelopmental delays.
